title: Liverpool star Andy Robertson hails 'excellent' Scott McTominay ahead of Man Utd clash
text:
Scott McTominay has been ever-present for Manchester United in the Premier League this season (Picture: Getty)

Liverpool defender Andrew Robertson believes Scot McTominay has had an excellent season despite Manchester United’s struggles ahead of the meeting between the clubs on Sunday.

McTominay has emerged as a fixture of Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s team this season, starting all eight of United’s Premier League matches so far, providing a goal and assist apiece.

However, United’s dreadful start to the campaign which has seen them take only nine points from their opening matches and languish just two points clear of the relegation zone, has seen McTominay and his teammates come in for criticism.

Andrew Robertson played alongside Scott McTominay during the international break (Picture: Getty)

Nevertheless, Robertson, who played alongside McTominay for Scotland during the international break, insists his compatriot has been in good form before admitting he wants to inflict another defeat on him and his teammates at the weekend.

‘There was a wee bit of banter with Scott McTominay during the Scotland duty, just a wee bit, not much, honest!’ Robertson said.

‘I thought Scotty was fantastic for us against San Marino, to be honest. And he’s been excellent all season in a United team that has had its critics. I think he’s carried himself very well.

‘I’ll be looking forward to facing him on Sunday. Obviously, I hope to come out on top.’

Despite being the away side, Liverpool are overwhelming favourites to beat their arch-rivals on Sunday having put together an impressive eight-match winning sequence in the Premier League this term.

Jurgen Klopp’s side have put their agonising second-place finish to Manchester City last season behind them and are eight points clear of Pep Guardiola’s men heading into the weekend fixtures.

Nevertheless, Liverpool haven’t beaten United at Old Trafford in ten years, stretching back to a 4-1 victory there in 2009 – a run of 13 games in all competitions.

‘Since I’ve been a Liverpool player, we’ve not managed to get a result at Old Trafford,’ Robertson said. ‘So hopefully that changes on Sunday.’
